review_blob: 2007 - Poured from bomber a nice cloudy caramel color with a tan head.  Smells strongly of hops and some caramel sweetness.  Front sweet flavor leaves quickly to sharp hoppy, syrupy alcohol back end.  Alcohol is not well hidden here, warms me up!  A little like a cough medicine.  Great Winter sipping beer.
beer_name: Smuttynose Big Beer Series: Barleywine Style Ale

review_blob: Poured from bomber, big, off-white head, that disappeared quickly leaving little lacing.  Color is a nice cloudy amber with little apparent carbonation.  Tough to smell much except for faint hops and onion? and pine.  Alcohol is not apparent, tough to believe that this is an 11%!  Very well hidden in a slightly copper, metallic, hoppy back end.  Front flavor and mouthfeel doesnt offer much, seems to be just a vehicle to get you to the hops on the back.  I would buy it again, but it wasnt my favorite from Southern Tier.

I really enjoyed this one.  Poured from a bomber, nice amber color, fine head with nice lacing.  Not as "red" as expected, but wow what flavor!  Front is rich caramel, sweet, some citrus.  Back is aromatic bitter hops, great balance, alcohol does not sting. Creamy and rich texture.  Great until the end.

Poured from bomber.  Pure white head with tight white small bubbles that dissipated quickly.  Moderate lacing.  Smells fresh and non-complex.  Not as hoppy or deep as other Southern Tier beers that I have sampled.  I purchased this in Chautauqua County, NY.  Supposed to be only for sale in this area.  Can be found on draft in many of the local restaurants in the area.  Good fresh simple drinking/summer beer.

Large soda-like light colored head with large bubbles, diminshed quickly.  Great raspberry caramel nose, lets you know what you are getting into.  Fairly thin and carbonated for a porter.  Sweet raspberry front, balanced by roasted, chocolate porter finish.  I enjoyed this very drinkable beer.
